image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: The South Australian premier says an investigation into an 18-year-old man's alleged threats of a "physical attack" at public events and to an Adelaide school was "the most complex" case he has been briefed on.

title.children: Teen called himself 'prophet of justice' in alleged school threats

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.Â

title.children: How an argument ended with the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: An alleged dangerous driver outside the Christies Beach Magistrates Court.

props.synopsis: A driver who rammed a motorcyclist into a pole during a road rage incident in Adelaide's south, leaving her with life-threatening injuries, has been jailed.

title.children: Road rage driver jailed after leaving woman 'lucky to be alive'

image.altText: Tom Koutsantonis talking in front of leafy a backdrop

props.synopsis: A ban on preferential bookings in a bid to ensure a fairer and more reliable access taxi system will come into effect next week.

title.children: Changes to 'broken' access cab system amid 'corruption' claims

image.altText: Luke holds a platter of edible insects next to wine glasses.

props.synopsis: From pet food to human food, insects have many potential uses in Australia. But the industry has to overcome some big challenges around public perception first.

title.children: Insects with your wine? Vineyard's bid to capitalise on growing trend

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: South Australia's work safety agency is examining the circumstances surrounding the collapse of a stone wall that claimed the life of a 46-year-old man on a property in the Barossa region.

title.children: Man killed in stone wall collapse in Barossa Valley

image.altText: A red and white sign reads '2022/23 flood level' with an arrow pointing down to a red line, a dirt levee is behind it

props.synopsis: A damning report reviewing one of South Australia's worst natural disasters in the state's history reflects on how some government agencies could have improved their response.

title.children: SA government agencies 'fell short' in flood response, report finds

image.altText: A group of emergency services personnel stand facing the back of an ambulance with a large white sheet to the left

props.synopsis: The man has been taken to hospital and is in a critical but stable condition.

title.children: Man bitten by shark off SA beach, emergency services say

image.altText: A mechanic with a car.

props.synopsis: The Coalition's election pledge for nuclear reactors caused deep divisions within the community of Port Augusta â now that it's been taken off the agenda, locals are looking towards different futures.

title.children: Nuclear off the table in Port Augusta, as locals look in other directions

image.altText: Repair works on electrical infrastructure.

props.synopsis: Business owners are urged to review their policies after a blackout that took 26,000 properties offline in March. Just one of 70 surveyed traders says their insurance has covered the losses.

title.children: What happens to a small town when the power goes out for 24 hours

image.altText: An illustration of a woman crying next to a burning house.

props.synopsis: The ABC went on a multi-country investigation in the Pacific to understand one of the world's worst gender violence crises. What we found was much more complicated than a story about victimhood.

title.children: When home becomes hell: Inside one of the world's worst gender violence crises

image.altText: A young woman holding a drill and sitting on a round table and a middle-aged man standing behind her holding a hammer in a room

props.synopsis: A social media star who purchased her first home during a road trip to outback NSW says renovating it and two other properties with her dad helps her unwind from her busy life.

title.children: TikTok star's outback reno side hustle boosts father-daughter bond

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old man has been arrested over a hit-and-run that claimed the life of a 20-year-old woman in Adelaide's north-east last week.

title.children: Man charged over fatal hit-and-run in Adelaide's north-east

image.altText: Two people walk past a steel sign reflecting in the sunlight that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Australia's RBA is meeting on Tuesday, but relatively strong wages and jobs data could see the board cut rates by less than some predicted. NAB is sticking by a forecast of half a per cent. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: NAB sticking by 'super-sized' RBA rate cut forecast for next Tuesday

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Market finishes up 0.6 per cent, with uranium losing out

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: Neither Russian President Vladimir Putin nor his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy will attend talks in Istanbul. The question now is, will these talks amount to anything?

title.children: With Putin refusing to attend talks, Zelenskyy was left with two choices

image.altText: Two adults and three children running along a beach, laughing.

props.synopsis: Kate and Kriss Hardman are determined to make joyful memories with their three young children as they travel around Australia under the cloud of breast and prostate cancers.

title.children: Mum of three with terminal cancer says 'don't wait to live your life'

image.altText: A series of houses in Sydney with numerous dollar signs edited into the picture next to the houses.

props.synopsis: Research from Cotality shows the portion of dwellings valued at $1 million or more has risen from just below 10 per cent in April 2015, to more than 34 per cent a decade later.

title.children: Why $1 million is far from an all-access pass to the housing market

image.altText: A satellite image shows the tops of buildings from above.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says a video it released that claimed to show Hamas-built tunnels underneath a southern Gaza hospital actually show different buildings.

title.children: Israel concedes error in video claiming to show Hamas tunnels under hospital

image.altText: A boy leans over a book and draws with a texter.

props.synopsis: Oliver arrived at Elaine's on the eve of his 7th birthday, with a black bin bag in tow. With no training to be a foster carer, she quit after three weeks.

title.children: 'I'm set up to fail': Foster carer quits after three weeks of caring for young boy

image.altText: Sussan Ley, David Littleproud, Angus Taylor, Peter Dutton QT 20221027_041653670_iOS

props.synopsis: David Littleproud and Sussan Ley have had a previously combustible relationship but will have to find a path forward.Â

title.children: The Coalition must figure out its answer to the net zero question

image.altText: A woman with dark blonde hair pulled back smiles lightly.

props.synopsis: The ACT health minister apologises for mistakes that led to the death of Jessica Bovill, who was given a dose of sodium bicarbonate "far in excess" of what was recommended, resulting in her death at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Jessica died due to a hospital error. Her family was told it was suicide

image.altText: Ellouisa Brighton Gibson.

props.synopsis: Ellouisa Patricia Brighton, 36, was charged with three counts of murder, three counts of attempted murder and one count of arson following the deadly house fire in Toowoomba last week.

title.children: Mother charged with murder of three children has matter heard in court

image.altText: A generic photo of a baby lying in the lap of a doctor who is holding syringe.

props.synopsis: Vaccination rates among children and teens have dropped to "critical" levels, according to experts, who are warning deaths are inevitable if Australia doesn't do more to turn the trend around.

title.children: Australian vaccination rates plummeting among young children

image.altText: a overview of Bayesian yacht

props.synopsis: A superyacht belonging to British tech tycoon Mike Lynch, which sank off the coast of Italy last year, was most likely knocked over by violent winds, according to an interim UK report.

title.children: Mike Lynch's yacht tipped 90 degrees in less than 15 seconds

image.altText: A woman in exercise gear at the summit of Mount Coolum.

props.synopsis: Being diagnosed with genital herpes as a teenager sent Jasmyn Gaggiano spiralling into depression. Since sharing her story, she has realised many others are suffering in silence.

title.children: Woman diagnosed with genital herpes as teen says shame was crippling

image.altText: Singer Cassie and Sean Combs pose on the red carpet, Diddy is wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The prosecution's star witness, Casandra "Cassie" Ventura, is cross-examined about drugs, sex and infidelity at Sean "Diddy" Combs's sex trafficking and racketeering trial.

title.children: 'Always ready to freak off': Cassie quizzed over texts at Diddy trial

image.altText: Chris brown on stage wearing a red jumper

props.synopsis: R&B singer Chris Brown has been charged with grievous bodily harm with intent over an incident at a London nightclub in 2023.

title.children: Singer Chris Brown charged over alleged nightclub assault

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: From party leadership votes to missing ballot papers and plunging spacecrafts to luxury aeroplanes, this week was a big one. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new Liberal leader, a luxury aeroplane and Eurovision

image.altText: Two young PNG boys stand in front of a pile of rocks, one looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: The World Health Ogranization says wild poliovirus type 2 was eradicated in 1999, but the deadly disease has been detected just over 500 kilometres from Australia's northern border.

title.children: A disease Australia wiped out in 2000 has resurfaced in our closest neighbour

image.altText: A slim elderly man in light blue shirt and glasses walks towards the camera outside a building on a sunny day

props.synopsis: A woman who survived sexual abuse at the hands of a convicted paedophile former priest fears he will hurt her again if the Timor-Leste government succeeds in having him pardoned.

title.children: Timor-Leste proposes pardon for 'evil' paedophile former priest

image.altText: Go-Jo on stage with arms out, red scarf and blue jumpsuit with billowing smoke around him

props.synopsis: Marty Zambotto, 29, known as Go-Jo, gyrates across the Eurovision Song Contest stage in the second semifinal, but fails to make the cut.

title.children: Australia misses Eurovision final for second year in a row

image.altText: Four police offers talk standing near a house

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man is charged with three counts of arson over fires at properties linked to British Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title.children: Man charged over fires at British PM's properties

image.altText: A computer generated image of flat path leading through flowers and low bushes, with tall city buildings in distance.

props.synopsis: Disability advocate Hannah Diviney has long pushed for more accessible public spaces. Now, Melbourne Design Week exhibition Beyond Barriers offers proof that inclusive design benefits everyone.

title.children: Hannah has to meticulously plan going out. Better design would change that
